about.description: This dataset contains medical malpractice data for practitioners across the US including practitioner's field, allegation type, state, etc.

columns.colDescription: Record Number. SEQNO is a unique number assigned to each record. The assigned numbers are not necessarily continuous or sequential.

Practitioner's Field of License. E.g., 10 - Allopathic Physician (MD), 20 - Osteopathic Physician (DO), 30 - Dentist, etc. Since the implementation of Section 1921 licensure actions on all practitioner types have been required to be reported to the NPDB.
Year original report processed. Year this record was processed into the NPDB. This variable is a reasonable substitute for year of Judgment or Settlement.
Practitioner's Work State in the US represented by state code.
Malpractice Allegation Group. E.g., 1 - Diagnosis Related, 10 - Anesthesia Related, 20 - Surgery Related, etc.
First Specific Malpractice Act or Omission Code. E.g., 100 - Failure to Use Aseptic Technique, 101 - Failure to Diagnose, etc.
Patient Type. B - Both, I - Inpatient, O - Outpatient, U - Unknown
Age Group of Practitioner. E.g., 10 - Ages 19 and under, 20 - Ages 20 through 29, 30 - Ages 30 through 39, etc.
Patient favorability index. Metric for measuring how favorable the settlement amount was for the patient.
